title: Ticket #3246: condor_gather_info should have an option to be more comprehensive
description:
[I'm actually submitting this a priority==2 for now, since I think it's something we run into again and again and would be a big time-savings for us when reporting issues -- and it would also reduce back-and-forth email ticket debugging latency since you've have everything from the get-go.]

I would love to see condor_gather_info do the following:

  • capture ALL the relevant daemon logs for the job (SchedLog, ShadowLog, StarterLog, StartLog.*) and tar them up -- even if they're gargantuan
    • for bonus points, just gather lines on or after the job submit time, which will often eliminate most of the extra log info at no information cost
  • capture the process table, and process tree ("ps auwx" and "pstree -up") and stick in a file
  • grab the userlog, stdout file, and stderr file for the job and include them
  • for good measure, capture the output of "uptime", "free", and "df -l".

The perfect is the enemy of the good for this -- if it's easier to be dumb and collect too much info, by all means do that. Be smarter only as time permits.
